text: Raorchestes hillisi is a frog. It lives in China. The scientists found 1719 meters above sea level. The adult male frog is about 16.6–21.6 mm long from nose to rear end and the adult female frog is about 18.9–20.5 mm long. The skin of the frog's back is brown with a darker mark between the eyes in the shape of a triangle There are some yellow spots on top of the head. Some frogs have small white bumps. Some frogs have a light line on the top of the body The belly is white-gray in color. Scientists named this frog after Dr. David M. Hillis of the University of Texas. ==References== Category:Frogs of Asia
title: Raorchestes hillisi
